item.title: MPs on all sides accuse Boris Johnson of Afghanistan failures
item.description: The PM says the UK achieved its goals - but MPs accuse him of failing Afghans and British veterans.

item.title: Ashraf Ghani: Afghanistan's exiled president lands in UAE
item.description: The UAE says it has welcomed the president and his family on humanitarian grounds.

item.title: IMF suspends Afghanistan's access to funds
item.description: The move follows the Taliban's takeover, and lack of global agreement over who now governs Afghanistan.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'I feel lucky to leave but we must not forget those left behind'
item.description: The UK government says 306 UK nationals and 2,052 Afghans have been flown out of the country so far.

item.title: Covid vaccines still effective against Delta variant
item.description: But the jabs were more effective against the Alpha variant, the largest study of its kind suggests.

item.title: Afghanistan crisis: Chaos at Kabul airport amid scramble to evacuate
item.description: Western countries are racing to evacuate their citizens and Afghans following the Taliban takeover.

item.title: Geronimo the alpaca: High Court bid to save animal refused
item.description: A last-ditch attempt to halt the animal's destruction is refused at the High Court in London.

item.title: R. Kelly called a 'predator' as sex abuse trial begins
item.description: The US R&B singer is accused of sexual abuse, racketeering and bribery; charges which he has denied.

item.title: Police officer and son's deaths in Kidderminster were murder-suicide
item.description: Three-year-old Harrison Louden was found dead alongside his father at their home on Friday.

item.title: Israel extends Covid restrictions to three-year-olds as cases surge
item.description: Young children must show proof of a negative test to enter many indoor spaces, as infections surge.

item.title: Apple censors engraving service, report claims
item.description: Apple restricts the engraving of political phrases in China, Hong Kong and Taiwan, a report alleges.

item.title: Film buff rescues more than 20,000 VHS tapes set for dump
item.description: A video shop owner travelled from Liverpool to Dundee to pick up the massive haul from a collector.

item.title: The Papers: MPs condemn US president, and Johnson 'humiliated'
item.description: Most of Thursday's front pages lead on reaction from UK politicians to the crisis in Afghanistan.

item.title: The White Lotus: HBO comedy-drama attracts rave reviews from critics
item.description: The HBO comedy-drama, which began in the UK on Monday, has received several five-star reviews.

item.title: Covid: 'I'm pregnant, should I have the vaccine?'
item.description: Many pregnant women have declined the Covid jab, but what's best for the baby?

item.title: Hunt for owner of engagement ring found at Tube station
item.description: James Flude, 28, hopes the owner will get in touch after finding the ring at Vauxhall station.

item.title: Brandon Flowers on new Killers album Pressure Machine, inspired by Utah hometown
item.description: The Killers frontman speaks about their new album, Pressure Machine, inspired by his rural hometown.

item.title: Surlingham pub car park 'rifle' threat arrest caught on film
item.description: Bodycam footage shows the response of armed police to reports of a man making threats with a rifle.

item.title: Snake slithers out of spice shelves at Sydney supermarket
item.description: The python greeted the woman at the spice shelves - luckily, she happened to be a snake rescuer.

item.title: MPs vent their fury over Afghanistan - but what impact will it have?
item.description: After a year of flat debates, a full Commons chamber proved harder for the prime minister to navigate.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'pure devastation and guilt' of British-Afghans
item.description: We chat to young people in the UK who have family in Afghanistan, as the Taliban take control.

item.title: How latte art in South Africa led to a job from hell in Oman
item.description: A South African barista was offered a dream opportunity in Oman but unknowingly signed away his freedoms.

item.title: Afghanistan: How many asylum seekers has the UK taken in?
item.description: The UK government says it will resettle up to 20,000 Afghan refugees, but warns it will "take time".

item.title: The little-known human stories behind emoji designs
item.description: The surprising story of how some tiny characters ended up on billions of smartphone keyboards.

item.title: Nubya Garcia: The British sax star who is jazzing up the BBC Proms
item.description: Saxophonist Nubya Garcia on playing Royal Albert Hall, the Mercury Prize and "natural vibrations".

item.title: Never mind going electric, where will we park?
item.description: UK roads are already jam-packed and that looks set to get worse as more people snap up EVs.

item.title: Love and money: 'I borrowed from a friend, it went wrong'
item.description: After sleeping on the night bus with her daughter, Jo was forced to borrow money.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'My family is stuck and there is nothing I can do'
item.description: Afghans who have settled in the UK tell BBC News of their fears for loved ones back home.

item.title: Osaka felt 'ungrateful' for not being able to appreciate success
item.description: Naomi Osaka says she felt "ungrateful" at points in the last year for being unable to appreciate her success.

item.title: Celtic edge towards Europa League groups with win over AZ Alkmaar
item.description: Celtic take a step towards the Europa League group stage with an impressive victory against AZ Alkmaar.

item.title: England recall Malan, drop Sibley & Crawley for third India Test
item.description: Yorkshire batsman Dawid Malan recalled to the England squad for the third Test against India, with Dom Sibley and Zak Crawley both dropped from the 15-man squad.

item.title: West Brom thump Blades to go top of Championship
item.description: West Bromwich Albion hammer Sheffield United at The Hawthorns to go top of the Championship.

item.title: Pacos de Ferreira v Tottenham Hotspur: Harry Kane to miss Europa Conference League tie
item.description: Harry Kane will not play for Tottenham in Thursday's Europa Conference League play-off first leg against Pacos de Ferreira.

item.title: Andy Murray: Former British number one loses to Hubert Hurkacz at Cincinnati Masters
item.description: Andy Murray is out of the Cincinnati Masters after a straight-set second-round loss to ninth seed Hubert Hurkacz.

item.title: Shoe technology 'hurting athletes' credibility' - Olympic champion Warholm
item.description: Norway's Olympic champion hurdler Karsten Warholm believes carbon-technology shoes are hurting credibility of athletes.

item.title: Afghanistan crisis: 'Many here will be deeply fearful for their future'
item.description: The BBC's Secunder Kermani reports from the heart of Kabul during the unfolding crisis in Afghanistan.

item.title: Afghanistan: Fatalities as shots fired at flag protest in Jalalabad
item.description: Protesters took to the streets of Jalalabad holding aloft the country's national flag.

item.title: What is Sharia law? What does it mean for women in Afghanistan?
item.description: The Taliban say they will govern Afghanistan according to the Islamic code known as Sharia.

item.title: Tom Tugendhat on UK and Afghanistan: Anger, grief, rage
item.description: Tory MP Tom Tugendhat speaks of the anger, grief and rage of veterans at the "abandonment" of Afghanistan.

item.title: 'Where were we in their hour of need?': MPs debate the Afghanistan crisis
item.description: MPs, including Afghanistan veterans, were discussing the unfolding crisis in an emergency debate.

item.title: 'It was very emotional on the plane out of Afghanistan'
item.description: Afghan businesswoman Hassina Syed speaks of her relief at getting out on a British military plane.

item.title: Afghanistan: What's the impact of Taliban's return on international order?
item.description: What is the diplomatic fallout and how allies and rivals are looking at the US following the Taliban takeover?

item.title: Taliban have been looking for me, says ex-Afghanistan bank governor
item.description: Militants have been knocking on the doors of places he used to live, Ajmal Ahmady says.

item.title: Afghanistan: Mysterious Taliban spokesman finally shows his face
item.description: The spokesman has appeared in public for the first time. But is there more than one Zabihullah Mujahid?

item.title: Ex-marine: I'm not leaving Kabul without my animal rescue staff
item.description: Founder of an animal sanctuary Pen Farthing urges ministers to get 71 people to safety in the UK.

item.title: Afghanistan: Female Kabul resident fears for future under Taliban
item.description: A woman shares her story of the day the Taliban arrived - and why she has lost all hope.

item.title: Covid: Do I have to self-isolate if I'm fully vaccinated?
item.description: Self-isolation rules have now been relaxed across the UK.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government has announced that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: UK holidays: What are the rules?
item.description: Going abroad is not straightforward, so many people are opting to stay in the UK for their holidays.

item.title: Covid vaccine: Fertility and miscarriage claims fact-checked
item.description: Posts claiming Covid vaccines cause miscarriages are not supported by scientific evidence.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: 'How I found out my dad was a best-selling sex writer'
item.description: Sara Faith Alterman was always close to her father. Then she learned he was concealing a secret.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Inside the dark world of 'incels'
item.description: Who are the angry young men who describe themselves as "involuntarily celibate"?

item.title: Wildfires: How Portuguese club Tondela drove through the flames
item.description: In Tondela, the bond between club and fans was at its strongest during the night in October 2017 when nobody slept.

item.title: Malta: The teenagers pulled from the sea and accused of terrorism
item.description: How three teenagers rescued from the Mediterranean Sea ended up in Malta accused of terrorism.
